meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Bolivia.
meanings.sent1: I exchanged my dollars for bolivianos at the bank.
meanings.sent2: In Bolivia, you can use bolivianos to buy souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted bolivianos, so I had to find a different one.
meanings.sent4: His love for collecting bolivianos was like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent5: The sound of clinking bolivianos in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: Maria is a boliviano who moved to the United States for college.
meanings.sent2: The bolivianos at the event shared stories of their homeland.
meanings.sent3: The group of bolivianos at the party brought a taste of Bolivia to the gathering.
meanings.sent4: The bolivianos' traditional dance was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The bolivianos' warm smiles welcomed me to their community.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant served delicious Bolivian food with boliviano spices.
meanings.sent2: She wore a colorful boliviano scarf to represent her heritage.
meanings.sent3: The boliviano flag fluttered proudly in the wind during the parade.
meanings.sent4: The boliviano culture is rich in traditions and celebrations.
meanings.sent5: The boliviano art showcased at the gallery was truly captivating.
